Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PhD1 (PhD-1, P. hamadryas alpha-defensin; UCSS1a; Arg-rich; natural AMPs; monkey, primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against the Gram-  bacterium E. coli (MIC 1.6 uM), and the Gram+ bacteria L. monocytogenes (MIC 1.3 uM), S. aureus (MIC3.8 uM), and fungus C. albicans (MIC 2.3 uM). 100 mM NaCl had only a small effect on activity against ohter microorgamisms but caused a large drop in activity against S. aureus (MIC >50 uM). Updated 9/2017; 7//2021 GW
Literature Information.Author: Tsvetkova EV, Aleshina GM, Shamova OV, Leonova LE, Lehrer RI, Kokryakov VN.2006
Literature Information.Title: alpha-Defensins from blood leukocytes of the monkey Papio hamadryas
